maml:description.maml:para: Exports a scan.
Exports a scan in Fortify Project Results (FPR) format.

maml:Description.maml:para: The id of the scan to export. Required.
The name of the file to export the scan to. Required.
WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
WebInspect API Authentication Method to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy server to use. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig.
{{ Fill IsCustom Description }}
Force verbose output. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig
The id of the scan to export. Required.
The name of the file to export the scan to. Required.
{{ Fill IsCustom Description }}
WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
WebInspect API Authentication Method to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy server to use. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig.
Force verbose output. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig

The export format to use. Required.
The name of the file to export the scan to. Required.
WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
WebInspect API Authentication Method to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy server to use. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig.
{{ Fill IsCustom Description }}
Force verbose output. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig
The id of the scan to export. Required.
The type of details to export. Required.
The export format to use. Required.
The name of the file to export the scan to. Required.
{{ Fill IsCustom Description }}
WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.

maml:description.maml:para: Generates a report from a scan.
Generates a report from a scan using the WebInspect API and exports the results to a file in the specified format.

maml:Description.maml:para: The id of the scan to generate the report for. Required.
{{ Fill ReportFormat Description }}
The type of report: "issue" or "compliance". Required.

If the value of ReportType is "compliance", then the value of ReportName must be the name of a compliance template. If the value of "reportType" is "issue", then the value of ReportName must the name of a custom report OR one of the standard reports. Use Get-WIReports to retrieve the available list. Required
{{ Fill OutFile Description }}
WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
WebInspect API Authentication Method to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy server to use. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig.
Use this switch if the report is a custom report otherwise a standard report is assumed.
Force verbose output. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig
The id of the scan to generate the report for. Required.
{{ Fill ReportFormat Description }}
The type of report: "issue" or "compliance". Required.

If the value of ReportType is "compliance", then the value of ReportName must be the name of a compliance template. If the value of "reportType" is "issue", then the value of ReportName must the name of a custom report OR one of the standard reports. Use Get-WIReports to retrieve the available list. Required
{{ Fill OutFile Description }}
Use this switch if the report is a custom report otherwise a standard report is assumed.
WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
WebInspect API Authentication Method to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy server to use. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig.
Force verbose output. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Export-WIScanReport -ScanId ff860346-2978-4f14-bae3-004ff0a535c2 -ReportFormat pdf -ReportType issue -ReportName Vulnerabilities -Outfile test.pdf

maml:description.maml:para: Get PowerShell For WebInspect module configuration.
Retrieves the PowerShell for WebInspect module configuration from the serialized XML file.

maml:Description.maml:para: Get the config data from either: PS4WI: the live module variable used for command defaults PS4WI.xml: the serialized PS4WI.xml that loads when importing the module Defaults to PS4WI.
If specified, read config from this XML file. Defaults to PS4WI.xml in the user temp folder on Windows, or .ps4wi in the user's home directory on Linux/macOS.
Get the config data from either: PS4WI: the live module variable used for command defaults PS4WI.xml: the serialized PS4WI.xml that loads when importing the module Defaults to PS4WI.
If specified, read config from this XML file. Defaults to PS4WI.xml in the user temp folder on Windows, or .ps4wi in the user's home directory on Linux/macOS.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the status of a scan.

A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy server to use. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig.
If the scan status is Running, wait for the scan status to change and then return the new value.
Force verbose output. Default value is the value set by Set-WIConfig

If the scan status is Running, wait for the scan status to change and then return the new value.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new ClientCertificateObject.
Create a new PS4WI.ClientCertificateObject for use in initiating a new scan.

maml:Description.maml:para: The system store name where the certificate is located. The predefined systems stores are: MY, Root, Trust, CA.
The serial number that uniquely identifies the client certificate.

If you want to embed the client certificate, use this field. the raw client certificate bytes in base64 encoded format. If this field is set then the values of "IsGlobal", "StoreName" and "SerialNumber" are ignored. Caution! When using the "Bytes" option, the client certificate is embedded in the scan settings and may be visible to other users.
If true, look for "StoreName" in the Local Machine machine hive. Otherwise look for "StoreName" in the Current User hive.
The system store name where the certificate is located. The predefined systems stores are: MY, Root, Trust, CA.
If true, look for "StoreName" in the Local Machine machine hive. Otherwise look for "StoreName" in the Current User hive.
The serial number that uniquely identifies the client certificate.

If you want to embed the client certificate, use this field. the raw client certificate bytes in base64 encoded format. If this field is set then the values of "IsGlobal", "StoreName" and "SerialNumber" are ignored. Caution! When using the "Bytes" option, the client certificate is embedded in the scan settings and may be visible to other users.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new ReuseFalsePositives object.

Create a new PS4WI.ReuseFalsePositives for use in initiating a new scan. Allows you to specify an array of ScanIDs to import the false positives from scans (containing vulnerabilities) that were changed to false positives. If those false positives match vulnerabilities detected in this scan, the vulnerabilities will be changed to false positives.

maml:Description.maml:para: Array of ScanIDS to import false positives from.
Array of ScanIDS to import false positives from.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new ScanReuseOptionsObject.
Create a new PS4WI.ScanReuseOptionsObject for use in initiating a new scan.

maml:Description.maml:para: A GUID representing an existing scan ID. The scan referenced by the "ReuseScan" parameter is used as a baseline.
The "Mode" parameter determines the manner in which the baseline scan is reused.
A GUID representing an existing scan ID. The scan referenced by the "ReuseScan" parameter is used as a baseline.
The "Mode" parameter determines the manner in which the baseline scan is reused.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new ScanSettingsOverrideObject object.
Create a new PS4WI.ScanSettingsOverrideObject with any custom settings overrides for use in initiating a new scan.

maml:Description.maml:para: Any alpha-numeric value, does not need to be unique. Required.

A number between 1 and 50 indicating the number of threads that the auditor should use (default is 10). SharedThreads is not compatible with CrawlThreads and AuditThreads. If SharedThreads is set, CrawlThreads and AuditThreads will be ignored.
The start option to use.
A MacroGenDescriptorObject which can be used to configure automatic login macro generation.
A webmacro file name. This file must exist in the WebInspect scan settings folder on the WebInspect machine.
A MacroParametersObject which can be used to override parameters defined in TruClient macros. The macros must exist in the scan settings and the parameters must exist in the macro.
Override the smart credentials defined in a session-based macro. The macro must exist in the scan settings and smart credentials must be enabled in the macro.
A ProxyConfigurationDescriptorObject to use which defines a proxy server.
Network authentication username and password. Use the NetworkAuthenticationMode setting to specify the authentication mode.
Specifies the network authentication mode when using NetworkCredentials, e..g. "myusername","mypassword"

An array of allowed "host:port" entries. Hosts found in "StartUrls" are automatically added to the allowed hosts list. Use the special value "*" to add all hosts found in workflow macros, login macros and start urls to allowed hosts. Caution! This is a convenience feature, and it can cause the scanner to go out of scope. Examples: "zero.webappsecurity.com:80", "zero.webappsecurity.com:443", "myhost:8888" or "*"
A list of valid, fully qualified URLs, including scheme, host and port. This field is only used if "StartOption" is "Url".
A RestEndpointDescriptorObject containing the REST end points to use.
The web form values to use.
An integer representing the policy id OR the GUID representing the policy unique id. Use "Get-WIPolicies" for a list of available policies.
An array of check IDs. A custom audit policy will be created from this list and used for the scan.
The scope of the scan.
Restrict the crawler to specific paths within a web site.
Either the location of the client certificate in the Windows certificate store OR the raw client certificate.
A UserAgentDescriptorObject which can be used to configure a predefined user agent or use a custom user agent string.
A WebServiceScanDescriptorObject which can be used to configure a SOAP Web Service Scan.
The crawl and/or audit mode to use.
The crawl coverage mode to use.
A KnownTechnologyDescriptorObject to use.

A number between 1 and 75 indicating the number of shared threads that the crawler and auditor should use (default is 1, meaning a single threaded scan). SharedThreads is not compatible with CrawlThreads and AuditThreads. If SharedThreads is set, CrawlThreads and AuditThreads will be ignored.

A number between 1 and 25 indicating the number of threads that the crawler should use (default is 1). SharedThreads is not compatible with CrawlThreads and AuditThreads. If SharedThreads is set, CrawlThreads and AuditThreads will be ignored.
If this switch is set, the scan will be created but it will remain in the stopped state.
If this switch is set, the traffic monitor will be enabled.
Any alpha-numeric value, does not need to be unique. Required.
A list of valid, fully qualified URLs, including scheme, host and port. This field is only used if "StartOption" is "Url".
A UserAgentDescriptorObject which can be used to configure a predefined user agent or use a custom user agent string.
A WebServiceScanDescriptorObject which can be used to configure a SOAP Web Service Scan.
The crawl and/or audit mode to use.
The crawl coverage mode to use.
A KnownTechnologyDescriptorObject to use.

A number between 1 and 75 indicating the number of shared threads that the crawler and auditor should use (default is 1, meaning a single threaded scan). SharedThreads is not compatible with CrawlThreads and AuditThreads. If SharedThreads is set, CrawlThreads and AuditThreads will be ignored.

A number between 1 and 25 indicating the number of threads that the crawler should use (default is 1). SharedThreads is not compatible with CrawlThreads and AuditThreads. If SharedThreads is set, CrawlThreads and AuditThreads will be ignored.

A number between 1 and 50 indicating the number of threads that the auditor should use (default is 10). SharedThreads is not compatible with CrawlThreads and AuditThreads. If SharedThreads is set, CrawlThreads and AuditThreads will be ignored.
The start option to use.
A MacroGenDescriptorObject which can be used to configure automatic login macro generation.
A webmacro file name. This file must exist in the WebInspect scan settings folder on the WebInspect machine.
A MacroParametersObject which can be used to override parameters defined in TruClient macros. The macros must exist in the scan settings and the parameters must exist in the macro.
Override the smart credentials defined in a session-based macro. The macro must exist in the scan settings and smart credentials must be enabled in the macro.
A ProxyConfigurationDescriptorObject to use which defines a proxy server.
Network authentication username and password. Use the NetworkAuthenticationMode setting to specify the authentication mode.
Specifies the network authentication mode when using NetworkCredentials, e..g. "myusername","mypassword"

An array of allowed "host:port" entries. Hosts found in "StartUrls" are automatically added to the allowed hosts list. Use the special value "*" to add all hosts found in workflow macros, login macros and start urls to allowed hosts. Caution! This is a convenience feature, and it can cause the scanner to go out of scope. Examples: "zero.webappsecurity.com:80", "zero.webappsecurity.com:443", "myhost:8888" or "*"
A RestEndpointDescriptorObject containing the REST end points to use.
The web form values to use.
An integer representing the policy id OR the GUID representing the policy unique id. Use "Get-WIPolicies" for a list of available policies.
An array of check IDs. A custom audit policy will be created from this list and used for the scan.
If this switch is set, the scan will be created but it will remain in the stopped state.
The scope of the scan.
Restrict the crawler to specific paths within a web site.
Either the location of the client certificate in the Windows certificate store OR the raw client certificate.
If this switch is set, the traffic monitor will be enabled.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new UserAgentDescriptorObject.
Create a new PS4WI.UserAgentDescriptorObject for use in initiating a new scan. Allows you to configure predefined user agent or use custom user agent string

maml:Description.maml:para: Standard option to use: firefox, internetexplorer, chrome, iphone, ipad, android, windowsphone, windowsrt, none.
Custom user agent string. If you would like to use custom user agent string then standard should be set to "none".
Standard option to use: firefox, internetexplorer, chrome, iphone, ipad, android, windowsphone, windowsrt, none.
Custom user agent string. If you would like to use custom user agent string then standard should be set to "none".

maml:description.maml:para: Send a request to the Webinspect REST API.
Send a request to the WebInspect REST API. This function is used by other PS4WI functions. It's a simple wrapper you could use for calls to the WebInspect API.

maml:Description.maml:para: REST API Method (Get, Post, Put, Delete ...). Defaults to Get.
Proxy server to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
WebInspect API Operation to call, e.g. /scanner/scans, this will be appended to $ApiUri
Hash table of arguments to send to the WebInspect API.
A File containing the Body to be sent to the WebInspect API.
The full path to a file to write the output to.
Content Type to send, if not specified defaults to "application/json".
WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
WebInspect API Authentication Method to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
If specified, don't explicitly remove verbose output from Invoke-RestMethod * WARNING * This will expose your data in verbose output.
REST API Method (Get, Post, Put, Delete ...). Defaults to Get.
WebInspect API Operation to call, e.g. /scanner/scans, this will be appended to $ApiUri
Hash table of arguments to send to the WebInspect API.
A File containing the Body to be sent to the WebInspect API.
The full path to a file to write the output to.

WebInspect API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.

A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy server to use. If empty, the value from PS4WI will be used.
If specified, don't explicitly remove verbose output from Invoke-RestMethod * WARNING * This will expose your data in verbose output.

maml:description.maml:para: Set PowerShell for WebInspect module configuration.

Set PowerShell for WebInspect module configuration, and $PS4WI module variable. This data is used as the default AuthMethod, Credential and ApiUri for most commands. If a command takes either a AuthMethod, Credential or ApiUru, they take precedence. WARNING: Use this to store the Credentials on a filesystem at your own risk Only supported on Windows systems, via the DPAPI

maml:Description.maml:para: Specify the API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083/webinspect.
The method of authentication to WebInspect API: None, Basic, Windows, ClientCertificate. Default is None.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy to use with Invoke-RESTMethod.
If set to true, we allow verbose output that may include sensitive data * WARNING * If you set this to true, your WebInspect data will be visible as plain text in verbose output
If specified, save config file to this file path. Defaults to PS4WI.xml in the user temp folder on Windows, or .ps4wi in the user's home directory on Linux/macOS.
Specify the API Uri to use, e.g. http://localhost:8083/webinspect.
The method of authentication to WebInspect API: None, Basic, Windows, ClientCertificate. Default is None.
A previously created Credential object to be used.
Proxy to use with Invoke-RESTMethod.
If set to true, we allow verbose output that may include sensitive data * WARNING * If you set this to true, your WebInspect data will be visible as plain text in verbose output
If specified, save config file to this file path. Defaults to PS4WI.xml in the user temp folder on Windows, or .ps4wi in the user's home directory on Linux/macOS.
